description: From Ancient Greek χάος (kháos, “vast chasm, void”),  +‎ -genous.

adjectives.description: chaogenous (comparative more chaogenous, superlative most chaogenous)

entries.meaning: That which is born from chaos.
examples: And after a time, the boiling sea of blood and all the lopped and all the hacked-up humanity that swam within it drained from mah head, and from it rose a pillar of chaogenous calculus, cold and hard.
